come with me to the bottom of the world
Antarctica the highest driest windiest

the entire continent sags below sea

Antarctica is a calendar of climate

temperatures going back before the onset

and here scientists are drilling into

others have been working to answer a

what is the exact relationship between

that temperatures are rising this past
May was the warmest worldwide on record

patterns winds ocean currents
precipitation rates cloud formation
things that bear on the health and

house and to the nearest ouse
it snows so heavily there the

buried indeed researchers picked this
site because ice and snow accumulates
here 10 times faster than anywhere else
in Antarctica they have to dig

exotic and chilly
commute but under the surface is a hive
of industrial activity centered around
an $8 million drill assembly
periodically this drill like a biopsy

10ft long cylinder of compressed ice

and Trace chemicals laid down by snow
season after season for thousands of
years it's really a time machine at the
peak of activity earlier this year the
re SE archers uh lowered the drill uh an

day and another 365 years deeper into
the
past periodically they remove a cylinder
of ice like gamekeepers popping a spent

chips more importantly they prepare it
for inspection and analysis by 27
independent Laboratories in the United

for 40 different Trace chemicals related
to climate some imp parts per
quadrillion yes I said that with a Q

and shipment back to these Labs some

site each cylinder is a parfait of

considering the radical new technology

alphabet based in polarized light and

material at depths where where pressures

inch every year it begins with a

we can see how this process is ongoing
today this wall of undisturbed snow back
lit by sunlight shows the striations of

and depositing them on the snow pack
year after year Millennia after

thick from this we can detect an
extraordinary number of things we can

place most importantly these cylinders
in this snow trap air each cylinder is

know what we need to know about

the
outlines and what we don't completely

we run the risk of making things worse
consider the single most successful
International environmental effort of
the 20th century the Montreal protocol
in which the nations of Earth banded
together to protect the planet from the

conditioners refrigerators and other
cooling devices we ban those chemicals
and we replace them
unknowingly with other substances that
molecule per molecule are a 100 times
more potent as heat trapping greenhouse

extraordinary precautions the scientists

about
4,500 ft of ice cores for shipment back

they manhandled them across the ice to
waiting

you the Precision of a watch is a

born over the years subtle changes in

oyster adding more Comfort while keeping
the style
contemporary and along with style more

face it was also the first wristwatch to
spell out the day of the week in
[Music]
full in the early 1950s Rolex developed
professional watches whose functions
went far beyond telling the time
launched in 1953 the Submariner was the
first Rolex watch guaranteed waterproof
to a depth of 330
ft already on an incredible journey of

push the boundaries even

the
outside the development of undersea
